headline: South Africa suits self-drivers; East Africa offers classic safari
summary: South Africa offers excellent value with self-drive options in Kruger and malaria-free alternatives in the Eastern Cape. East Africa (Tanzania, Kenya) provides the classic safari experience with vast ecosystems and the Great Migration. South Africa suits budget-conscious or self-reliant travelers. East Africa suits those wanting the quintessential safari narrative.

assumptions.text: South Africa's Kruger allows self-drive safari, significantly reducing costs.
The Great Migration only occurs in East Africa (Tanzania and Kenya).
South Africa offers malaria-free safari options in the Eastern Cape and some private reserves.

gains: South Africa: Self-drive option saves significant money
East Africa: Classic African safari narrative and scale
losses: South Africa: Kruger can feel more vehicle-dense
East Africa: Requires guided vehicles in most parks
East Africa: Malaria prophylaxis required everywhere

change_conditions: If the migration is a priority, East Africa is the only option.
If self-drive appeals, South Africa is the clear choice.
If malaria avoidance is essential, South Africa offers alternatives.
If budget is primary, South Africa self-drive provides best value.
